IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO REPRESENT RESTAURANT OWNERS AND VENDORS IN ORDER TO AID THEM IN MARKETING THEIR RESTAURANTS, ACCOMPLISHMENTS, AND CONTRIBUTIONS TO THE LOCAL ECONOMY. WE RECOGNIZE LEADERS IN THE LOCAL INDUSTRY AT AN ANNUAL AWARDS EVENT AND OFFER COOPERATIVE MARKETING OPPORTUNITIES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO REPRESENT RESTAURANT OWNERS AND VENDORS IN ORDER TO AID THEM IN MARKETING THEIR RESTAURANTS, ACCOMPLISHMENTS, AND CONTRIBUTIONS TO THE LOCAL ECONOMY. WE RECOGNIZE LEADERS IN THE LOCAL INDUSTRY AT AN ANNUAL AWARDS EVENT AND OFFER COOPERATIVE MARKETING OPPORTUNITIES.
IRS990.Desc: ANNUAL MEETING AND OTHER EVENTS-THE SPONSORSHIP OF MEETINGS AND EVENTS TO PROMOTE INDUSTRY INFORMATION AND COMMUNICATIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: RESTAURANT ASSOCIATION OF METROPOLITAN WASHINGTON CONTRIBUTES TO LOBBYING ORGANIZATIONS AND POLITICAL CAMPAIGNS.

THE ASSOCIATION HAS NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT QUALIFY FOR EITHER RECOGNITION OR DISCLOSURE IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, AND NO INTEREST AND PENALTIES HAVE BEEN RECORDED IN THE ACCOMPANYING FINANCIAL STATEMENTS RELATED TO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS.
THE FUNDS ARE PROVIDED TO VARIOUS ORGANIZATIONS AS GENERAL UNRESTRICTED CONTRIBUTIONS. THE ASSOCIATION DOES NOT REQUIRE THAT THE FIRMS REPORT BACK.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE 990 IS REVIEWED BY A BOARD APPOINTED SUB-COMMITTEE, PRESIDENT AND TREASURER; AFTER IT IS FINALIZED IT IS MADE AVAILABLE TO ALL BOARD MEMBERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY COVERS ALL MEMBERS OF THE BOARD, OFFICERS AND STAFF MEMBERS AND IS MONITORED BY ANNUAL SIGNING OF THE POLICY BY ALL THE ABOVE MENTIONED PERSONS WHICH IS REVIEWED AND MAINTAINED BY THE PRESIDENT. THE ENTIRE BOARD REVIEWS EACH TRANSACTION TO COME BEFORE THE BOARD FOR POTENTIAL OR ACTUAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST. IF POTENTIAL OR ACTUAL CONFLICTS (PAST, PRESENT OR FUTURE) ARE IDENTIFIED, THE BOARD SHALL DETERMINE WHETHER A CONFLICT OF INTEREST EXISTS AND, IF SO THE BOARD SHALL VOTE TO AUTHORIZE OR REJECT THE TRANSACTION OR TAKE ANY OTHER ACTION DEEMED NECESSARY TO ADDRESS THE CONFLICT AND PROTECT RAMW'S BEST INTERESTS. ANY INTERESTED BOARD MEMBER, OFFICE OR STAFF MEMBER SHALL NOT PARTICIPATE IN ANY DISCUSSION, DEBATE OR VOTE IN WHICH THERE MAY BE A PERCEIVED OR ACTUAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST. THE IDENTIFIED CONFLICTS OF INTEREST AND APPROPRIATE RECUSALS ARE DOCUMENTED IN THE MINUTES OF EACH BOARD OR COMMITTEE MEETING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.

RESPONSIBILITY FOR OVERSIGHT OF REVIEW- THE ORGANIZATION HAS A COMMITTEE THAT ASSUMES RESPONSIBILITY FOR OVERSIGHT OF THE REVIEW OF ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT.

DisregardedEntityName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: THE RAMW EDUCATIONAL FOUNDATION INC DBA EDUCATED EATS

IdRelatedTaxExemptOrgGrp.PrimaryActivitiesTxt: BUILDING PARTNERSHIPS BETWN LOCAL COMMUNITY AND DC AREA PUBLIC HIGH SCHOOLS.

IdRelatedOrgTxblCorpTrGrp.PrimaryActivitiesTxt: ESTABLISHED TO PROMOTE THE INTERESTS OF THE FOODSERVICE INDUSTRY.
ESTABLISHED TO FIGHT THE ELIMINATION OF TIPPING OF RESTAURANT WORKERS IN DC.
